alert.note: Alert for Bastrop (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 31 at 4:21PM CST until January 31 at 8:30PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bastrop County in south central Texas... * Until 830 PM CST. * At 421 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Near Copperas Creek and Alum Creek. The debris flow can consist of mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Elgin, Bastrop, Smithville, Camp Swift, Circle D-KC Estates, Wyldwood, Rosanky, Cedar Creek, Paige, Upton, Phelan, Bastrop State Park, Hills Prairie, Alum Creek, Buescher State Park, Watterson, Cedar Hills, McDade, Rockne and Togo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
